metadata.title: CVE-2022-25235 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - high
metadata.description:
xmltok_impl.c in Expat (aka libexpat) before 2.4.5 lacks certain validationof encoding, such as checks for whether a UTF-8 character is valid in acertain context.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-25235` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.2.9-1ubuntu0.2
libexpat1 - 2.2.9-1ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: expat package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.9-1ubuntu0.2').
xmlrpc-c package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
wbxml2 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
swish-e package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
cadaver package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
matanza package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
tdom package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'bundled deps handled by upstream in new versions').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'bundled deps handled by upstream in new versions').
libxmltok package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
